qas.question: What elements mix for Egyptian music?
Who is credited with invention of music by ancient Egyptians?
What artist are considered the golden age of Egyptian music?

answers.text: Abdu El Hamouli, Almaz and Mahmoud Osman, who influenced the later work of Sayed Darwish, Umm Kulthum, Mohammed Abdel Wahab and Abdel Halim Hafez

qas.question: What is more contemporary Egyptian Pop Singer?

context: Egyptian music is a rich mixture of <a0_0>indigenous, Mediterranean, African and Western<a0_0/> elements. It has been an integral part of Egyptian culture since antiquity. The ancient Egyptians credited one of their gods <a1_0>Hathor<a1_0/> with the invention of music, which Osiris in turn used as part of his effort to civilise the world. Egyptians used music instruments since then. Contemporary Egyptian music traces its beginnings to the creative work of people such as <a2_0>Abdu El Hamouli, Almaz and Mahmoud Osman, who influenced the later work of Sayed Darwish, Umm Kulthum, Mohammed Abdel Wahab and Abdel Halim Hafez<a2_0/> whose age is considered the golden age of music in Egypt and the whole Middle East and North-Africa. Prominent contemporary Egyptian pop singers include <a3_0>Amr Diab and Mohamed Mounir<a3_0/>.
